original_title: Sri Lanka expected to reach deal with bondholders by second review: IMF report
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka is expected to reach an in-principle deal with bondholders by the second review of the program, an International Monetary Fund report said.

“Staff has also assessed that the authorities engage in good faith negotiations with the International Sovereign Bond (ISB) bondholders with a view to reaching an AIP no later than the second review of the EFF…” a report released after the completion of the first review of the IMF program said.
Negotiations with the China Development Bank was also at an advanced stage, the report said.
Bondholder representatives negotiating with Sri Lanka authorities have however complained that details of in principle deals reached with official creditors have not been shared with them.
In the case of Sri Lanka bond holders represent the biggest single creditor group.
An initial proposal involving restructured debt linked linked to GDP growth, was rejected by Sri Lanka. (Colombo/Dec13/2023)
